title: Katagami Textile Stencil (1 of 2) with Stylized Pine Bough Design
dimensions:
paper: H. 32.4 x W. 42 cm (12 3/4 x 16 9/16 in.)
pattern unit: H. 22 x W. 35.4 cm (8 11/16 x 13 15/16 in.)
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Gift of Dr. Denman W. Ross
medium: One of a pair of chûban (medium-sized) sheets of minogami (mulberry bark paper) treated with persimmon juice and cut using the "kiribori" (drill-carving), "dôgubori" (punch-carving), and "tsukibori" (thrust-carving) techniques; with overprinting in blue
